definition.value: an obesity AE that requires BMI 25 - 29.9 kg/m2
an obesity AE that requires BMI 30 - 39.9 kg/m2
an obesity AE that requires BMI >=40 kg/m2
a flushing AE that has symptomatic, associated with hypotension and/or tachycardia; limiting self care ADL
a hematoma AE that requires minimally invasive evacuation or aspiration
a hematoma AE that requires transfusion, radiologic, endoscopic, or elective operative intervention
an hypertension AE that has prehypertension (systolic BP 120 - 139 mm Hg or diastolic BP 80 - 89 mm Hg)

an hypertension AE that for Adult: has stage 1 hypertension (systolic BP 140 - 159 mm Hg or diastolic BP 90 - 99 mm Hg); medical intervention indicated; recurrent or persistent (>=24 hrs); symptomatic increase by >20 mm Hg (diastolic) or to >140/90 mm Hg if previously WNL; monotherapy indicated; for Pediatric: recurrent or persistent (>=24 hrs) BP >ULN; monotherapy indicated.

an hypertension AE that for Adult has Stage 2 hypertension (systolic BP >=160 mm Hg or diastolic BP >=100 mm Hg); medical intervention indicated; more than one drug or more intensive therapy than previously used indicated; for Pediatric: Same as adult.

an hypertension AE that for Adult has life-threatening consequences (e.g., malignant hypertension, transient or permanent neurologic deficit, hypertensive crisis); urgent intervention indicated; for Pediatric: Same as adult
a peripheral ischaemia AE that has brief (<24 hrs) episode of ischemia managed non-surgically and without permanent deficit
a peripheral ischaemia AE that has a recurring or prolonged (>=24 hrs) and/or invasive intervention indicated
a vasculitis AE that shows severe symptoms, medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids)
a vasculitis AE that shows threatening; evidence of peripheral or visceral ischemia; urgent intervention indicated

an alopecia AE that has hair loss of <50% of normal for that individual that is not obvious from a distance but only on close inspection; a different hair style may be required to cover the hair loss but it does not require a wig or hair piece to camouflage

an alopecia AE that has hair loss of >=50% normal for that individual that is readily apparent to others; a wig or hair piece is necessary if the patient desires to completely camouflage the hair loss; associated with psychosocial impact
a dry skin AE that is coverying <10% BSA and no associated erythema or pruritus
a dry skin AE that is coverying 10 - 30% BSA and associated with erythema or pruritus; limiting instrumental ADL
a dry skin AE that is coverying >30% BSA and associated with pruritus; limiting self care ADL
an erythema multiforme AE that has target  lesions covering <10% BSA and not associated with skin tenderness
an erythema multiforme AE that has target lesions covering 10 - 30% BSA and associated with skin tenderness
an erythema multiforme AE that has target lesions covering >30% BSA and associated with oral or genital erosions
an erythema multiforme AE that has target lesions covering >30% BSA; associated with fluid or electrolyte abnormalities; ICU care or burn unit indicated
a hyperhidros AE that shows limited to one site (palms, soles, or axillae); self care interventions
a hyperhidros AE that has Involving >1 site; patient seeks medical intervention; associated with psychosocial impact
a hyperhidros AE that has Generalized involving sites other than palms, soles, or axillae; associated with electrolyte/hemodynamic imbalance
a palmar-plantar erythrodysesthesia syndrome AE that has minimal skin changes or dermatitis (e.g., erythema, edema, or hyperkeratosis) without pain
a palmar-plantar erythrodysesthesia syndrome AE that has skin changes (e.g., peeling, blisters, bleeding, edema, or hyperkeratosis) with pain; limiting instrumental ADL
a palmar-plantar erythrodysesthesia syndrome AE that has severe skin changes (e.g., peeling, blisters, bleeding, edema, or hyperkeratosis) with pain; limiting self care ADL
a periorbital edema AE that has soft or non-pitting
a periorbital edema AE that has indurated or pitting edema; topical intervention indicated

a periorbital edema AE that has edema associated with visual disturbance; increased intraocular pressure, glaucoma or retinal hemorrhage; optic neuritis; diuretics indicated; operative intervention indicated
a photosensitivity reaction AE that has painless erythema and erythema covering <10% BSA
a photosensitivity reaction AE that has tender erythema covering 10 - 30% BSA

a photosensitivity reaction AE that has erythema covering >30% BSA and erythema with blistering; photosensitivity; oral corticosteroid therapy indicated; pain control indicated (e.g., narcotics or NSAIDs)
a pruritus AE that has mild or localized; topical intervention indicated

a pruritus AE that has intense or widespread; intermittent; skin changes from scratching (e.g., edema, papulation, excoriations, lichenification, oozing/crusts); oral intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
a pruritus AE that has intense or widespread; constant; limiting self care ADL or sleep; oral corticosteroid or immunosuppressive therapy indicated
a purpura AE that has combined area of lesions covering <10% BSA
a purpura AE that has combined area of lesions covering 10 - 30% BSA; bleeding with trauma
a purpura AE that has combined area of lesions covering >30% BSA; spontaneous bleeding
a skin atrophy AE that has covering <10% BSA; associated with telangiectasias or changes in skin color
a skin atrophy AE that has covering 10 - 30% BSA; associated with striae or adnexal structure loss
a skin atrophy AE that has covering >30% BSA; associated with ulceration
a skin hyperpigmentation AE that has hyperpigmentation covering <10% BSA; no psychosocial impact
a skin hyperpigmentation AE that has hyperpigmentation covering >10% BSA; associated psychosocial impact
a skin hypopigmentation AE that has hypopigmentation or depigmentation covering <10% BSA; no psychosocial impact
a skin hypopigmentation AE that has hypopigmentation or depigmentation covering >10% BSA; associated psychosocial impact
a stevens-johnson syndrome AE that has skin sloughing covering <10% BSA with associated signs (e.g., erythema, purpura, epidermal detachment and mucous membrane detachment)
a stevens-johnson syndrome AE that has skin sloughing covering 10 - 30% BSA with associated signs (e.g., erythema, purpura, epidermal detachment and mucous membrane detachment)
